meanings.definition: Resembling a club in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The tree had a claviform trunk that widened at the base.
meanings.sent2: The rock had a claviform appearance, with a thick, rounded top.
meanings.sent3: The claviform cloud looked like a giant cotton candy in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her claviform shadow stretched across the pavement as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The claviform silhouette of the mountain against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: The claviform handle of the hammer fit perfectly in his hand.
meanings.sent2: The mushroom had a claviform stem that widened towards the top.
meanings.sent3: The claviform cake was a hit at the party, shaped like a giant club.
meanings.sent4: His claviform fingers gripped the steering wheel tightly as he drove.
meanings.sent5: The claviform building stood out among the square structures in the city.
